biography.content: John Doucette is an Associate Professor in Engineering Management in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the University of Alberta, Edmonton, AB, where he carries out research in network restoration, network reliability and availability, network optimization, eHealth & healthcare ICT, railway operations, and various applications of operations research & optimization. He completed a B.Sc. in Mathematics from Dalhousie University, Halifax, NS, a B.Eng. in Industrial Engineering from the Technical University of Nova Scotia, Halifax, NS, and a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Alberta, Edmonton, AB. He joined the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the University of Alberta in 2005. He also holds an Adjunct Scientist appointment at TRLabs, Edmonton, AB. He has authored over 50 peer-reviewed journal and conference publications and approximately 30 technical reports and other presentations, and is co-inventor of 3 patents.
